intro: Hieracium spodoleucum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounded by a dense, white to pale yellow disk of tubular flowers. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures, and it produces achenes as its seed dispersal mechanism.
